title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The first point is for setting up a left Riemann sum. The setup must be a sum of three products.

A response may still earn this point if there is only one numerical error in the expression for the Riemann sum with values pulled from the table. (See example below).

Responses with the numerical error described above are not eligible for the second point.

Note: either the multiplication or the addition may be indicated implicitly. For example, the response may show appropriate values put into rows and columns, like so.

·

or

Implicit responses such as those above are eligible for both points.

A response presenting a right Riemann sum (instead of left), will not earn any points for part (a).

The second point is for the correct numerical result.

In order to earn the second point, there must be supporting calculations.

The numerical values for N ( 0 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E53@ N ( 10 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F0E@ and N ( 35 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E65@ must be pulled from the table.

Any simplification shown must be correct.

Use the following as an illustration of how to score both points. (In most cases, you see scores for which the expression on the left side represents the entirety of relevant work shown for the response.)

· A response of ( −8 ) ⋅ ( 10−0 )+( −11 ) ⋅ ( 35−10 )+( −13 ) ⋅ ( 40−35 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6574@ earns both points.

· A response of 10 ⋅ N ( 0 )+25 ⋅ N ( 10 )+5 ⋅ N ( 35 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5E0C@ earns the first point. Eligible for second point if more work is on the page.

· A response of 10 ⋅ N ( 0 )+25 ⋅ N ( 10 )+5 ⋅ N ( 35 )=− 420 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@63C4@ earns both points.

· A response of 10 ⋅ ( −8 )+25 ⋅ ( −11 )+5 ⋅ ( −13 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@59AD@ earns both points.

· A response of 10 ⋅ ( −8 )+35 ⋅ ( −11 )+5 ⋅ ( −13 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@59AE@ contains one numerical error. Earns the first point. Not eligible for the second point.

· A response of 10 ⋅ ( −8 )+25 ⋅ ( −11 )+5 ⋅ ( −13 )=− 400 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5F63@ earns first point for left side of equation. Does not earn second point due to incorrect simplification.

· A response of ( −80 )+( −275 )+( −65 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4759@ or ( −80 )+( −275 )+( −65 )=− 420 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D11@ does not earn the first point because we cannot see the sum of three products. However, this is the correct sum, so we are not seeing an unsupported answer. The second point will be earned.

The response does not need to include “approximately” in any way. We will read = MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGH9aqpaaa@3A02@ and ≈ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgIKi7caa@3ACD@ as the same thing.

Minimalist response: The following expression represents the minimum work that must be seen in a response in order to earn both points.

10 ⋅ ( −8 )+25 ⋅ ( −11 )+5 ⋅ ( −13 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@59AD@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

This point is earned when the response states that the approximation is an overestimate because N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ is decreasing.

The response does not need an explicit reference to part (a) or to a left Riemann sum.

A response that appeals to concavity as a reason will NOT earn this point.

The following table contains some examples of what WILL or will NOT earn the point.

The following examples earn the point:

· Underestimate because N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ is decreasing

· Underestimate because N ′  ( t )<0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FAC@

· Underestimate because the graph of N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ is decreasing (we know they are talking about the given function N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ )

· Underestimate because the function is decreasing. (There is only one function in the problem at this point.)

The following examples do not earn the point:

· Underestimate because N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ is concave down/up

· Underestimate because the graph/curve is decreasing. Since no graph/curve is provided, we do not know what graph/curve they are talking about.

· Underestimate because the table [or table values] is/are decreasing. The behavior of the values shown in the table is not the same as the behavior of the function N. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobGaaiOlaaaa@3A81@ The table does not tell us what is happening to N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ between the given points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The first point is earned for the correct approximation shown with supporting work.

We need to see both a difference and a quotient. They don’t have to be together.

The expression does not need to be simplified, but values for N ( 35 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E65@ and N ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DA3@ must be pulled from the table.

Decimal approximation is not expected, but if presented, then the decimal value must be correct to three decimal places, either rounded or truncated. We do not read anything past the third decimal place.

· If the first three places match −0.142 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8A@ or −0.143 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8B@ then the point is earned.

· It does not matter whether any subsequent decimal places match the correct value or not. (For example, the value −0.1424 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E48@ will earn the point because the first three decimal places match the correct value.)

· Responses with fewer than 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIZaaaaa@39B9@ decimal places ( −0.14, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7E@ −0.1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaigdacaGGSaaaaa@3CC0@ etc.) will not earn the point

The response does not need to include “approximately” in any way. We will read = MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGH9aqpaaa@3A02@ and ≈ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgIKi7caa@3ACD@ as the same thing.

The second point is for correct units.

Units must be attached to a numerical value (either correct or incorrect).

Can be written using words or a combination of words and symbols. For example:

· Coins per minute per minute or Coins/min/min MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4485@

· Coins per min 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4553@ or Coins/min 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41EF@

· Coins per minute squared

We do not read work shown in part (d) for this point. The units must appear in part (c).

The letter “ C MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGdbaaaa@39C4@ ” is not a standard abbreviation for “Coins.” It will not be interpreted as such.

The response will not be penalized for any attempt to verbally describe their answer after a correct answer has been presented.

Minimalist response: The following expression and units represent the minimum work that must be seen in a response in order to earn both points. −13+8 35 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E91@ coins/min 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@420F@ or −13−( −8 ) 35 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4112@ coins/min 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@420F@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Three components of a correct answer:

· Indicating a rate of a rate

· Including the context of coin preparation (coins remaining)

· Explicitly referring to the specified point in time ( t=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaicdaaaa@3C70@ )

Incorrect or missing units will not be penalized as long as there is a clear connection to the context of the problem.

The words “increasing” and “decreasing” are interpreted as modifiers describing one of the specified rates.

If the numerical value from part (c) is used in this interpretation, then we expect that the choice of “increasing” or “decreasing” is consistent with that value.

The following examples use −1 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiabgkHiTiaaigdaaeaacaaI3aaaaaaa@3B75@ as the imported value from part (c). If a different [incorrect] value is imported from part (c), then these statements should be consistent with that value. (Remember that we are reading = MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabg2da9aaa@3A22@ and ≈ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgIKi7caa@3ACD@ as the same thing.)

· “… increasing at a rate of −1 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiabgkHiTiaaigdaaeaacaaI3aaaaaaa@3B75@ ” is OK [Units not required in part (d)] (the point is not earned with this phrase alone)

· “… decreasing at a rate of −1 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiabgkHiTiaaigdaaeaacaaI3aaaaaaa@3B75@ ” is OK [Units not required in part (d)] (the point is not earned with this phrase alone)

· “… decreasing at a rate of −1 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiabgkHiTiaaigdaaeaacaaI3aaaaaaa@3B75@ ” is not OK and the point is not earned.

Note: the context is complicated. N ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE2@ is describing the rate of change of the remaining unprepared coins. The values in the table indicate that the number of unprepared coins is decreasing more rapidly as time passes. Common sense might tell us that this equates to the idea that the rate at which coins are prepared is increasing as time passes. Explaining the meaning using “coins prepared” rather than “coins remaining” will not prevent the response from earning this point.

Rate of a rate

To earn this point, the response must explicitly discuss the rate of change of a rate of change. For example:

· The rate of change in the rate at which coins are changing

· The rate of change in coins is changing/increasing/decreasing at a rate of … MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqWIMaYsaaa@3A1E@

· The rate at which the rate of change of coins is changing

The words “increasing,” “decreasing,” or “changing” are not interpreted as rates.

Units are not interpreted as rates. (The phrase “coins per minute” is not enough to indicate a rate.)

Slope of tangent line, velocity, and acceleration are not appropriate interpretations for this context.

“Rate of change of N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ ” is not enough without describing what N MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobaaaa@39CF@ represents in this context.

Context

A key component of the context for this explanation is “coins.”

Any misstatement about coins prepared vs. coins remaining will not prevent the response from earning this point.

Explicit reference to t=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaicdaaaa@3C70@

Acceptable references to a specific point in time include (but are not limited to):

· At minute 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGimaaaa@3A71@ (where minute could be replaced with any other unit of time)

· At t=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaicdaaaa@3C70@ (with or without units of time)

· After 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGimaaaa@3A71@ minutes (where minutes could be replaced with any other unit of time).

Note: we are choosing to assume that “after” is being used in lieu of “at” unless we have additional evidence to the contrary.

If the response is explicitly indicating an interval of time (e.g., “from minute 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGimaaaa@3A71@ on” or “during the first 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGimaaaa@3A71@ minutes”), this point will not be earned.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

This point is earned with a correct tangent line equation in any form. Any of these equations can be written as is without any explanation or additional supporting work. If rewriting of equations is done (transforming to slope-intercept form, perhaps), it must be done correctly.

· y=−0.2( t−35 )−13 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4565@

· y+13=−0.2( t−35 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@455A@

· y=−0.2t−6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40BB@

The key calculus concept being assessed in this part of the problem is that the value of N ′  ( 35 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E71@ is the slope of the tangent line. In that spirit:

· The response will not be penalized for using x MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4baaaa@39F9@ instead of t. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaaiOlaaaa@3AA7@

· We are accepting N (t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGobGaaGjcVlaacIcacaWG0bGaaiykaaaa@3DB2@ in lieu of y MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG5baaaa@39FA@ in all forms of the tangent line equation.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The first point is earned with a correct substitution. There are 3 components of substitution that we need to see:

· Uses u= t 4 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D73@ which may be done implicitly

· Uses the correct constant of 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI0aaaaa@39BA@

· Uses the correct limits for the substitution ( 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaaaaa@39B6@ and 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGimaaaa@3A71@ ). These limits may only be seen when evaluating the antiderivative. We don’t need to see them as limits on a definite integral.

Either of the expressions 4N ( t 4 )  | 0 40 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44ED@ or 4N ( u )  | 0 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@441D@ will earn the substitution point without any additional supporting work.

Special Handling: Notation Errors

Errors in notation, such as the examples listed here, will not prevent the response from earning the first or second points. These errors will cause the response to be ineligible for the third point.

· Limits for t MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0baaaa@39F5@ attached to an integral with u MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG1baaaa@39F6@ as the variable of integration (or vice versa)

· Improper equals signs, such as an indefinite integral equal to a definite integral

· Reversed limits of integration, for example: ∫ 10 0 N ′  (u)  du MathType@MTEF@5@5@@478D@

The second point is for the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

This point can be earned with any of the following, where k MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGRbaaaa@39EC@ is a nonzero constant and b=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGIbGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaicdaaaa@3C5E@ or b=40. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGIbGaeyypa0JaaGinaiaaicdacaGGUaaaaa@3D13@ No explanation or additional supporting work is necessary.

· kN ( t 4 )​ | 0 b MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44AD@

· k( N (b)−N (0) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@459D@

This point can be earned without the substitution point.

The third point is for the correct numerical value, which is −12. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaGOmaiaac6caaaa@3C12@

Values from the table must be used. 4( N ( 10 )−N ( 0 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4639@ is not enough to earn the answer point.

The expression 4( −11−( −8 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CB@ is sufficient for this point. No simplification is required. Any simplification that is shown must be correct.

Units are not required, and if shown, they do not need to be correct to earn this point.

The response cannot earn this point without also earning first two points.

Minimalist response: The expression 4( −11−( −8 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CB@ represents the minimum work that must been seen in a response in order to earn all three points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Philosophy for this part: This question was difficult due to the fact that the new function introduced here represents the total number of coins prepared by the second child, but the question asks about the total weight of the coins remaining.

The key calculus concept being assessed in this part of the problem is to understand that the rate of change in the total weight of the coins (either prepared or remaining) at time t=23 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGOmaiaaiodaaaa@3C74@ could be written as an expression involving a constant multiple of F ′  ( 23 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F18@ In that spirit, either of the following expressions will earn the point: 5 F ′  ( 23 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F25@ or −5 F ′  ( 23 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40C4@

Notations such as 5 ⋅  dF dt | t=23 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47FF@ may also be used and earn the point.

The expression must use the time t=23, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGOmaiaaiodacaGGSaaaaa@3D24@ so 5 F ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ is not sufficient to earn the point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

This point is earned for a correct statement identifying the distinction between the differential equation dy dt = F ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42C5@ and the given slope field.

In order to earn the point, the response must:

State that the values of the differential equation are positive while the slopes in the given slope field are negative or 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaaaaa@39B6@ (non-positive).

Some ways to say that the values of differential equation are positive:

· F MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGgbaaaa@39C7@ is increasing

· F ′  ( t )>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA8@

· F MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGgbaaaa@39C7@ has positive slopes

When discussing the slopes in the slope field, the response must explicitly refer to the signs of the slopes.

The following examples could earn the point:

· The slope field has nonpositive slopes.

· The slopes shown are negative or 0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaaiOlaaaa@3A68@

· The slope field contains negative slopes.

· “The graph” or “The field” could be used in lieu of “The slope field.”

The following examples will not earn the point:

· The slope field is decreasing/negative.

· The slope field looks like it represents a decreasing function.

· The slope field represents a quadratic [or exponential] function.

· “It” (rather than “the slope field”)

Statements like “ F MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGgbaaaa@39C7@ is an increasing function, so the signs of the slopes in the slope field should be positive” can earn this point because “should be” is indicating contrast with what is known.

The response will not be penalized for saying that the slopes in the slope field are “always” negative or “all” negative.
